alert.note: Alert for Southeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 18 at 1:24PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Southeast Prince William Sound, including Cordova. * WHEN...From late Monday night through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is good potential for periods of heavy rain Monday through Wednesday. There is some uncertainty in the exact timing and placement of heaviest rain. At this point in time, it looks like the heaviest rain for the Cordova area will be Tuesday night through Wednesday. Storm total rainfall Monday through Wednesday night of 4 to 9 inches is possible. While rainfall totals look like they will be less than during the recent flood event September 7th to 9th, they might end up only marginally lower for this coming storm. Thus, there is potential for similar impacts. Flooding is possible along Eyak Lake, including Power Creek Road. Flooding is also possible along areas rivers and streams. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to weather.gov/Anchorage, NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
